Reviews.Title: “Better than sleeping in your car.”
Reviews.Author: yukonimj
Reviews.Content: Was in Vancouver for medical reasons so needed to be near VGH. Had booked at the Park Inn but they stuffed up our reservation so they found uss this gem. Price was fantastic $67.15/night medial rate. There was a reason for that. Trying to get into the hotel was challenging. Can't turn left from to get into parking lot and can't turn left on 12th to get onto Kingsway to get into hotel. Room was small. And HOT. Window did open but they are building a new high rise out the back so couldn't leave the window open due to noise. Bathroom was tiny. And when taking a shower in the morning, the water waivered between ice cold and scalding hot so couldn't stand under the spray. The shampoo, conditioner and mouthwash were great. Would I stay here again? Well - the price was right and it is better than nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a couple of days given the price.”
Reviews.Author: The_Travel_G0ddess
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend visit and found the hotel reasonable given the price (you get what you pay for). While it's not right in downtown Vancouver, the #19 bus stops right at the hotel and it is a short ride away. There is a continental breakfast, although the room is a bit unusual. The hotel is dated, the room was small but it was clean and included in the price is internet access and a safe in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Olivia F
Reviews.Content: While the hotel was old and unrenovated, it was clean enough and the staff were friendly. The internet worked, which we were happy about. However, my partner and I both left with numerous bed bug bites.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one or two nights! Well priced...”
Reviews.Author: Gazpacho16
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Howard Johnson on a weekend visit to Vancouver in 2009. The rooms were dated but clean, and the service was friendly and efficient. I had rented a car, and the complimentary parking was much appreciated. I do appreciate the fact that management is looking into renovating this property. It does look like it was built 50 years ago, and maybe it is time for an upgrade! Overall, the Howard Johnson fulfilled my needs. Compared to other hotels I have stayed in the past it is average, but definitely not as terrible as others have rated it.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, disgusting, YUCK!”
Reviews.Author: Latte S
Reviews.Content: The absolute only things positive were that I was able to get a room without any reservations and it came with free parking. I should've known at that point that something was wrong. Bathroom was filthy, there was no sink stopper and it made a loud sound like someone was plunging the toilet, the springs to the beds felt like they should've been replaced 20 years ago, the carpets were super old and dirty, and the rooms smelled funny. Basically, I strongly suggest that you look somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Believe the other reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra M
Reviews.Content: When we were looking at reviews of this place we saw a few mixed ones so we went with it anyway. Worst. Decision. Ever. The room was small and airless, no fans were provided, the exhaust system in the bathroom didn't work the bed was ok but the pillows were terrible, they looked like the belonged as decorative pillows on a sofa they were so small. The breakfast was terrible, according to the review comments the management say they have improved the breakfast, if this is an improvement then i'd hate to see how it was before. the milk for the cereal was not on ice, therefore warm and undrinkable, the pastries looked and tasted like they were 3 days old and the coffee tasted like muddy water, we stayed here for 4 days and we chose to skip breakfast for 3 of those days. Your best bet is to head to he cafe down the road that does a %5.95 brekky, its is much tastier!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever..Living on the street would be a upgrade to staying here for $125 a night!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Je01234
Reviews.Content: Hotel is pretty much a run down, depressed looking building...staff was unfriendy and didn't help answer our questions...Continental breakfast was a joke...Had to retrieve a voucher at the front desk only to find out later that they were handing out vouchers to anyone off the street. Overall, stay at the Best Western down the street. You will be glad you did!!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad at all”
Reviews.Author: backpacker_f
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not a bad spot for a short stay in town. Even though the position could be not the best, the area is pretty well served by bus and it's very easy and fast to get downtown and back, even at night. The room was really small...the pictures on website really misleading ;-) The breakfast is poor...food is not so fresh at all...and the crew of the hotel is pretty rude. Anyway for 95 dollars you can have your room with wifi and breakfast...if you cannot find better deal, this could be a good choice

Reviews.Title: “Believe the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: San_Diego2007
Reviews.Content: Avoid this place....it is not even "just a place to sleep". The room and linens were so dirty it made the thought of sleeping impossible. The rooms it self is very tired. Arrived in the evening trying to check in and had to wait for some runaway to call her parents in an attempt to get a room for the night....not the best area...not the worst....but that is the clientele. Towels in the room are so thin, using them after a shower is difficult. The room was absolutely disgusting.....sheets were not changed, it was a very bad 3 days. Again...believe the bad reviews, I just left here and everything about this place says "find another hotel".

Reviews.Title: “Not the cleanest and a bit dated.”
Reviews.Author: rtl2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the price, and as it was the cheapest place going it was OK. The advertised pool was not available due to "refurbishment". The room was very dated, and there were hairs in the bathroom on the wall and floor. A lot of the TV channels were not tuned in. A fair walk into town but manageable. Left early to catch the Amtrak cascades so missed breakfast. There was building work on an adjacent plot but this did not disturb me. My friends room was however next to an ice machine and people using that disturbed them throughout the night. The free Wifi kept cutting out - I had to log in about every 5 mins.

Reviews.Title: “needs work”
Reviews.Author: Jeff R
Reviews.Content: The lobby was clean and thats were it ends. We had 3 rooms that all needed work. Everything from missing art work on the walls to the in-room safe was stolen. Bathrooms were dark and dirty. Mold in the tiles grossed me out. Spend you hard earned money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T DO IT!”
Reviews.Author: MJM7777
Reviews.Content: Terrible place. The staff are unfriendly and unprofessional. The hotel itself is unpleasant and old. Our room actually had a pre-filled out comment card with a fake rave review. The continental breakfast comes with an unpleasant woman screaming "NO FOOD TO ROOM!!!!" at anyone who so much looks at the door. Also, the internet wasn't working when we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with free parking”
Reviews.Author: lukino6
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel mainly because of its location and the fact that it offered free parking. During check-in I realized that the receptionist was from the same country as I was so we had a little talk and she kindly explained to me how to get to the city centre and provided me with a map. The hotel's location is very good, it's only 10 km away from the airport, and the downtown can be reached by bus that stops near the hotel. The room was a of a standard size, exactly what you would find in any other hotel in the Wyndham chain. Free internet access is avaliable via Wifi or the business centre. The hotel has its own restaurant and a bar, and vending machines with drinks and snacks are also present. Overall, I rate this hotel an excellent choice for guests who arrive by car and don't want to be charged for parking, as well as for those who need to stay closer to the airport, yet not too far from downtown. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some reviews say it is.”
Reviews.Author: JFinSEA
Reviews.Content: So I read some pretty horrific reports about this place. My expectations were at the low end of the spectrum, especially since I'd gotten a 50/night USD rate off of Kayak. Have to admit I prejudged the place as a pit and it felt confirmed when I drove up. Actually it was a wrong first impression. Sure the building looked not so new. My checkin was very pleasant and even with my cheap rate was given a room on the 6th out of 7 floors. I fully expected the room do be a dump, but for the price, I could deal with it. Well again, I was surprised. Room 628 with 2 double beds wasn't bad. No drooping wallpaper, nothing ratty, was not bad. I took plenty of pictures do document what I saw. What negatives about the room I did discover were the heater fan was a little noisy on start (it quieted down quickly enough), There was a tiny amount of mold in the caulking of the soap dish in the shower, and the TV remote batteries were dead. Location seemed to be just fine. It wasn't downtown, but it didn't take me very long to drive it. My destination also included Burnaby and it was only 15 or so min there. It was kind of a handy location overall. There was an ATM in the lobby to get cash, and there were several places to eat nearby as well. They did serve the typical continental breakfast which was about as good as anyone else. I did try the place called Reno's and for a cheap meal and breakfast all day, wasn't so bad, not fancy by any means. The room was quiet, with decent beds. No bedbugs whatsoever. Room was clean and I even spoke to the friendly maid. I did hear the Karoke a bit in the evening, but with the room fan on I didn't even notice. I had come prepared with earplugs, but never used them. Shower had decent pressure, plenty of towels and the usual bathroom supplies. With the curtains drawn room was plenty dark. Never saw people lingering around the hotel other than those waiting at a bus stop. In fact the first night there, it snowed and at 2am, there were people playing in the snow on the street. TV had plenty of chanels and the wireless (which you renew each day using a code from the front desk) worked just fine for looking things up and checking messages. I didn't do any real downloads, but for my needs it was fine. Any interactions I had with the staff were friendly and pleasant. I think people have given this place a bit of a bum wrap. This was my experience November of 2010..

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Rainy81
Reviews.Content: Hi guys, This is a ok hotel a bit of a walk out of the centre of Vancouver but there is a great public tansport network so don't let that put you off. The hotel as the title says is a bit dated and could use a re-vamp. The staff were very helpful and always very polite. You get great service but a tired hotel. The breakfast was good and thrown in for free.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: krabbir95
Reviews.Content: think of the worst hotel.....this is it ! I had to switch hotels 1/2 hr after checking in...it was that gross

Reviews.Title: “FALSE Advertising”
Reviews.Author: Bkmrk7
Reviews.Content: Come on - update the photos and show what a dump this hotel has become. Howard Johnson's should be embarrased that they have their corporate name on this property. If you are OK with spending $80-90 per night and getting a sub-standard room that does not look like the pictures, nor feel safe, nor not looking for edible food, then go ahead and book here. Doesn't take much to put some $$$ into a property to make to worthwhile, or remove the pictures showing rooms that don't exist - or there are only a couple of them.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: beaslie
Reviews.Content: What the ads/website doesn't tell you is that: a) there is a nightclub attached to the building that has live "music" 7 nights a week... we were there for 2 nights - Monday and Tuesday - and each night the "music" played until at least 1:00 am b) "free parking" - there is a small lot (approx 20 cars) that is locked up at midnight each night; on our second night there, we arrived back at the hotel at 10:30 pm and it was locked; the desk clerk said the lot was full; our room overlooked the lot and there were still a number of spots empty; we ended up having to park in a deserted public parking lot across the street that was unlit and untended - needless to say my husband and I both had nightmares of a stolen/vandalized vehicle c) "complimentary breakfast" - is served in a long closed down dining room; you are provided with stale bread (honest) for toast, corn flakes or cheerios, orange juice, coffee/tea; the furniture is in horrendous condition - the fabric worn through to the foam core, exposed staples, pins, nails The photos on the website are from it's better days - truly not accurate of the property today... While the neighbourhood to the north/east/west is okay, the immediate vicinity is quite dodgey... as mentioned the nightclub with the hard pounding music nightly, many homeless/street people (so many that the lobby is also locked at midnight)... when we arrived back one night, there was a guy in a rage over some issue who was swearing, throwing things at the wall and stomping on something... we stayed in the car in the vacant parking lot until he was leaving - it was only then that the "security guard" came out to see what the commotion was about... While the price was "reasonable", it truly was not a comfortable experience for the two evenings... better to pay more and feel safe!

Reviews.Title: “take the upgrade option!”
Reviews.Author: lauren28Sydney
Reviews.Content: i stayed for 7 days as i was visiting friends. i had booked though hotelclub.com and paid for thee upgrade. when i checked in i was given the normal queen room. the next day i went down and requested i be put in the upgraded room and the staff member tried to tell me that my reservation had been cancelled. turns out he had made a mistake - no apology though! i was given the upgrade at that time. the original room was small and stuffy and didnt really have a good view of the city. the bed rolled away when i went to sit on it. the sheets were old and un-ironed. the upgraded roo was bright and had a nice view of the rockies! it had aa flat screen TV, the sheets were new and ironed. the bed didnt move! the room was much better quality for an extra CAD$35 for the week. the upgrade also has a microwave and mini fridge! the free breakfast was pretty poor. the one day i went for it at 9am most things had run out.. i wouldnt recommend it. interet connection was good. it is not very close to downtown. its about 2 bus rides away. 1 to cambie st then one from there to downtown - still only takes about 15 mins to get bdowntown. or from cambie st you could walk. its only 1 bus to the amtrak/ VIA rail/ greyhound stattion from right at the hotel door! there are some nice cafes and shops right near the hotel and a bar just behind it on prince edward st where live bands play. there is a small shopping centre nearby. it felt like a pretty safe area. i walked back late on my own from the bus stop late at night most nights with no problems at all. i wouldnt recommend eating at the hotel bar. it was pretty average food. you can walk down the road and get heaps better food. if you want to stay downtown then i would recommend looking elsewhere. but if you are not fussed about that and want it to be cheaper in price then i would recommend this place. it was a lot cheaper then the downtown HoJo.

Reviews.Title: “The stay was pleasant and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: food184843
Reviews.Content: The room was small but very nice. The continental breakfast was very nice - it included eggs and toast which was a surprise. However, we were charged $3.00 for Internet usage which did not happen and unfortunately only noticed the charge upon our arrival home.

Reviews.Title: “great budget hotel, close to city centre”
Reviews.Author: iainwhiteford
Reviews.Content: Howard Johnson plaza is a great hotel, on the outskirts of downtown vancouver. For the fortnight it only cost us 600 GBP between the two of us and is great value, with friendly service, excellent maid service and friendly helpful staff. It is only half an hour or so walk into the very heart of downtown vancouver but there is a bus service right to the door that will get you there in ten minutes, or a 5 minute walk to the skytrain which can get you to the waterfront in minutes. All in all if i was coming back to vancouver i would definitely come here every time 5 stars

Reviews.Title: “Go to the Best Western 2 blocks away instead!!!”
Reviews.Author: cinnamon193
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my mom and we were in a two-double bed room. The room was run down, appeared unrenovated for decades. There was hardly room enough to squeeze between the beds, carpets were stained, and fingerprints all over the windows. We actually had to leave before our first night because I could not stand the immensely overpowering, cheap air freshener smell everywhere in the halls and rooms. We tried to air out the room, but the smell was making me feel physically sick. Contrary to others' reviews, the staff was quite helpful and courteous. We ended up staying at the Best Western Uptown (205 Kingsway), a short two blocks away, for the SAME PRICE! It was a world of difference, and the staff admitted they actually get alot of business from customers leaving the HoJo to stay with them. The Best Western very, very clean, had spacious rooms, a cute courtyard, and renovated rooms (granite countertops in the bathroom). Most of all - no smells!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value I have received in a Hotel stay in quite some time.”
Reviews.Author: CowanEdmonton
Reviews.Content: In being awarded some work for the Vancouver Olympics I required 8 rooms for up to 6 weeks in advance of the games. I contacted the hotel and received an enthusiastic and interested party on the other line. I was given consideration for the number of rooms and length of stay. To help determine whether we should use them I went and quietly stayed there for a night. Not the newest, not the largest of rooms, but a clean, functional room met me with a very comfortable bed. I had a great sleep and found all of their staff helpful and pleasant to deal with. I would definitely stay there again (and will when next back in Vancouver). Blaine MacMillan

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: moovrshaykr
Reviews.Content: The price drew me in. Clean, comfortable, in an older building. Parking was available but the 2-way single lane ramp could be an issue on a busy day. Free wireless internet but the lobby internet kiosk required payment. Not fancy but overall not bad.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: orm76
Reviews.Content: don't waste your money and time. My worst stay in a hotel ever, the staff were so impolit. We were not expecting a lot from the hotel, but even our low expectation was not met. The environment was not friendly at all. Rooms are ugly, and old. But the worst were staff. They do not look like hotel staff at all. They charge for internet, even using the desktop in the lobby you have to pay!!!! Who would do that these days????????

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend this hotel, if you have a car, long bus ride to downtown.”
Reviews.Author: sharsinclair
Reviews.Content: very nice and clean, staff are by far the friendliest I have seen yet.

Reviews.Title: “unless you want a miserable time, don't go here”
Reviews.Author: versechorusjvh
Reviews.Content: Okay, where to begin. First of all, this is 2009 and they are not only charging for internet access (you have to buy a one hour, three hour, or one day pass - ten dollars extra for one day of internet? you have to be kidding me) the company that set up their wireless doesn't exist anymore, so if you have any problems you're SOL, because the people that work at the hotel are clueless and can only refer you to a phone number that doesn't go through. Second, every hallway on every floor has this distinct urine-like aroma. It smells like a combination of urinals and those freshener pucks they put in urinals. Third, there is a sleazy nightclub right underneath in the same building and there's all these sketchy characters hanging around the hotel lobby on the weekends. Fourth, and I am not in the least bit racist, but it is very frustrating when there is such a strong cultural barrier between yourself and the staff of a hotel. I speak very understandable English and still had a lot of frustration trying to deal with the staff that had a hard time understanding me (but didn't have any problems talking to each other in Chinese.)

Reviews.Title: “A Satisfactory stay”
Reviews.Author: S-Dbaby
Reviews.Content: Their rates are affordable and the rooms are decent and comfortable. overall our stay was fine and we will be staying with HJ again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: kingBC
Reviews.Content: We searched many hotels in vancouver and we founf HOward johnson plaza hotel. when we arrived there the staff was very friendly, Manager came out at the fron desk and welcome us at the hotel. All thee information were provided. Rooms were small but nice & clean and we were very much satisfied with the price and service we received.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it”
Reviews.Author: tiddy999
Reviews.Content: After a wonderful cruise to Alaska, we stayed at the Howard Johnson Plaza before we flew home to the UK. It wasn't chosen by us but by the agent we did the package with. I had read some poor reviews for this place but as it was only two nights we took the risk. When we arrived the desk manager was abrupt and un-welcoming. After hanging about for half an hour we were given a room on the 7th floor. Not a bad room at first sight but the bed linen looked grey and creased, had the linen been changed? we don't know but didn't want to stay as the safe was broken. After a word with duty manager she tried to sort the safe out but gave up and gave me three keys for other rooms on the same floor. We found a room with a working safe and clean bedding and moved all our stuff over. We heard a few complaints from other guests, rooms not being cleaned, safes not working. One old gentleman told me that as he had no credit card the manager said rudely " You will give $100 " , "What did you say" the guest asked, the manager repeated his demand, "And you will say please" said the guest. "I don't need you to teach me manners and if you don't like it get out" The guest backed down and gave him the money. We asked for a taxi to be booked to go to the airport "$30 plus $15 for the luggage I was told by the Manager , when challenged about the luggage charge he backed down, we heard of another couple being charged $50 in an unmetered taxi booked by the hotel The area surrounding the hotel isn't great but we didn't encounter any problems ourselves. Due to advise from others we stayed close by at night. The Salt and Pepper Grill was great for breakfasts and evening dinner, the fish and chips are great. The hotel bar was handy for a drink without going out at night I couldn't find anything at all that I liked about the Howard Johnson Plaza, and will book my own accomodation in future

Reviews.Title: “What are they thinking?”
Reviews.Author: believeme123
Reviews.Content: ﻿When I arrived at this hotel, I thought, "Wow, this is not exactly what I thought it was!" I will say the staff is friendly except for an issue we had with two staff members, but the hotel its self is dingy. Looks like to me they slapped a bit of decorating in places to make it look nice online but once you arrive you feel you need to take a shower as soon as you step in the door. The floors were not clean. Huge dust bunnies in the corners. Nasty finger prints all over the windows and doors. From what it looked like to me, someone had gotten sick outside by the front doors and no one cleaned it up. I didn't want to stay but if I left I would be charged any ways due to the 48-hr cancellation clause. On a plus side we were treated wonderfully by a gentleman at the desk. He made my daughter laugh which was great in my books. I don't think it would be smart to put his name on here but he was a man with dark hair/ touch of gray and a mustache. Thank You Sir for you kindness. As far as the two gentlemen we were not happy with. I think maybe this hotel should do some rethinking about whom they hire. One man was hitting on my daughter. I wanted to loose it on him. Yes she is beautiful and yes she looks older then she actually is but being only 14 years of age is not the only problem I had with this so called gentleman. I heard him make a comment along the lines of what he would love to do to my daughter and then he spoke in his own tongue and I cringe to think what he said. We are use to men hitting on her. What angers me the most is this man from what I was told by one of the staff members is that this man runs the front desk. He shouldn't be doing these kind of things in a family oriented environment. If he wants to be a pervert maybe he should find another job. He was very lucky my husband was not with us. I was too scared to leave my daughter alone at any time during our stay at this hotel. The other thing that upset me is late one night I had gone to get some ice and while I was walking back to our room I saw the security guard getting off the elevator groping a woman in the hallway as they entered a room, I’m not sure if he saw me and if he did he didn’t seem to notice. Needless to say we did not stay our last night. I left feeling dirty and discussed by this outrageous display of filth. I feel no matter how nice this hotel can look and how spotless it can be, there is no amount of money in this world that would convince me to stay there again. I really feel for the hard-working staff at this hotel. Working under and with nasty men such as these must be really hard on them. I wish them the best of luck.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Placebo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as the starting point for a 7 week North American holiday. We actually returned to Vancouver along the way and stayed here a second time. Rooms were clean, staff were generally very helpful. The restaurant was VERY ordinary - but there are many eateries within easy walking distance. For breakfast, you can't go past the Salt and Pepper Grill which is only a couple of hundred metres down the road - we ate there regularly (evenings as well). The bus into the city stops at the front door and only takes about about 15 minutes. It's only a 20 minute walk to the skytrain station if you prefer (or you can catch the same bus to there) - and the main coach terminal is at the same intersection. Not a five star hotel by any stretch - but good value if you just want somewhere clean and convenient to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking!”
Reviews.Author: havinfuntravelling
Reviews.Content: Ok, where do I start? My family (husband and 2 sons 10 & 12 and myself) booked 2 nights stay on the hotel website. We thought its a Howard Johnson, must have some standards to keep. Oblviously not. We arrived late in the evening, and found security at the door. The noise from the bar in the lobby made it very difficult to check in, as we had to shout over the kareoke. Very strange comings and goings all around. We were given our key for our double room. We just manage to squeeze the four of us and 2 suitcases into the elevator, and went up to room 723. On the door the sign above the room number said "office". Thought a bit strange, but in we go. The room was 1 small room, knocked through to another, room 724. Looking around we thought it seemed dirty, and my husband went to open the window, which was filthy. The beds I noticed were fold outs from the wall, and behind the "mattress" I could see alot of dirt in the gap to the wall. I thought about bed bugs, and decided to check out the bed. I lifted the sheets to find not a mattress, but a foamy, the kind you would use for camping. When I lifted this,...this was the worst part..... I found a deep red blood stain, aprroximatley 2 feet in diameter, soaked into the underside of the foamy! When further looking at the bed base, it seemed that whatever happened there, the bed had been folded back into the wall while the blood was still wet, as it had ran down the bed base, while upright. To think that whatever happened here caused so much blood loss was disturbing enough, but to think that the hotel would not even change the piece of foam or even clean the blood stained frame, I find appaulling! After many words with the manager, mainly him tring to put us in seperate single rooms, then 1 single room with a cot (not sure who he expected to sleep on that) We where moved to another double room, which was ment for someone else that had not yet shown up. No doubt they ended up in 723/4. This room was on the 3rd floor, and was a smoking room. We don't smoke, it stunk. The beds were not even 3/4 beds, no hairdryer, no fridge, no peace from the intersection outside our window. We had left the hotel that night too look else where, but with it being the long weekend, we could not find a room for that night. We had stayed at the Best Western Uptown, which is on the same block, once before which was very nice, and we would recommend it to anyone. But it too was full. Needless to say we checked out the next morning, and stayed at a wonderfully clean hotel elsewhere. I wish I had thought to take photos, all I can say is it was a long upsetting night for my entire family.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New Remodeled”
Reviews.Author: thanitha
Reviews.Content: We stayed during Memorial day weekend. It appeared that the hotel just finished the remodel. Everything is brand new. The laundry iron was still in the box, unopened. The room is very clean, quiet with a very good view. The price is right $US 75 for 2 persons. We stayed on the 5th floor where there is a soda machine but ice maker is on the 6th and 4th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: BloomersDT
Reviews.Content: We asked for a non-smoking room, only to be given a room that reeked of smoke. They kindly gave us a new room, but in this room the floors had not been vacuumed so they were filthy with left over food from the previous occupants. When we pulled back the bed to check for stains (I had read a previous forum to do this), I found that both sides of the bottom sheets were about 4 inches too short to tuck in. They were just hanging over the sides. After contacting the front desk, a man came to the door and handed me two new sheets to fix the bed myself. When we went to take a bath, we found that the bathtub plug would not stop the water from flowing out and mold growing on the inside of the soap dish. You should not stay at this hotel!!!.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and good locale for cheaper Vancouver stay.”
Reviews.Author: CathiM
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after booking through Trip Rewards, thought the price was great for a Howard Johnson. I had planned on 3 nights but as a female traveling alone I was scared off by what friends had to say about the old Biltmore and the area. I had to stay 1 night as it was too late to cancel and not get charged for the first night, I was pleasantly surprised. Not the greatest locale and I won't walk around alone at night but the room was clean and furniture was fairly new, I too checked the mattress based on an old review! I moved to a more uptown hotel for the next 2 nights and paid twice as much + parking. All I care about when I travel is a clean bed and bathroom, I don't come to Vancouver to sit in a hotel room. The lobby is tacky and I don't know about bar noise as I stayed a Tuesday night and it was quiet. Certainly some questionable characters about, but you mind your business and they mind their's. Treat people with respect and I find I have no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Neither bad nor good”
Reviews.Author: Chenchomelo
Reviews.Content: During the 4 days in which I stayed at this hotel I only had one complaint which was noise coming from the bar on friday night. The noise wasn't intolerable but was noticeable, lucky for me I was beat that day so I was able to sleep. The bad thing is that a possibly drunken guest was shouting on his cell phone in the corridor and that woke me up and kept me from sleeping for a while. I was not charged with surprise fees nor did they change the rates on me, which was good. The only advise I'd give them is that they recarpet their floors since there's a slightly funky smell emanating from their corridors; no funky smell on the rooms though. Some people say the neighborhood is bad and I don't know where they get that! They probably live in Beverly Hills or something. The neighborhood was pretty clean and safe and downtown was only 2 transfers away: take Bus 19 towards Stanley Park get off on Transfer & Main, then take SkyTrain Westbound and get off at Granville Station. This alone will take you 12 minutes tops. The bus stop is located right next to the hotel. Keep in mind there's another Howard Johnson located IN downtown so make sure you know which is which!

Reviews.Title: “Worst sleep ever”
Reviews.Author: aaaaah
Reviews.Content: The Bar below the hotel is so loud you will not be able to sleep. Drunk patrons fight and scream at each other for hours outside the bar, it started at 1:30 am and went until 3:00 am. Not worth it, we were so tired all weekend from not being able to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel...”
Reviews.Author: JCole07
Reviews.Content: Stayed at what used to be the Biltmore Hotel (now a HOJO Plaza Hotel) in Vancouver. The location was near where our relatives lived in Vancouver, thus chose this hotel. The hotel from the outside is nothing fabulous, but certainly not dungy. Inside, the front foyer nicely decorated. Our room had 2 double beds and it was quite tight for movement for 3 people. The rooms were clean and kept nicely through our stay of 5 days. One disadvantage was that it boasted an outdoor pool in the telephone book ad...no pool. Another thing is they boasted a free breakfast. Well, as we werent told when we checked in if we get free breakfast, we didnt think much of it. The next morning we were on our way out of the hotel and saw a FREE BREAKFAST sign. Oh, we thought, good for the next day. The next morning, went down to the restaurant for free breakfast, was told we needed a voucher from our hotel package, that the restaurant was under new management. Fine, we went to the front desk to obtain one. The front desk personnel indicated it was for new check-ins as of that day, but since we'd checked in the day before, we were eligible and gave us vouchers. The continental breakfast was good, and they had hot items for purchase as well. The next morning, went down again to the front desk, to obtain vouchers for breakfast, we were told they stopped that promo (as the front desk clerk slid the book of vouchers to the side). So we went down and had a hot breakfast and paid for it. It was good and very reasonably priced. We continued to check every morning, were not given anymore vouchers, but still saw vouchers being given out so we werent sure if we not on the A-list for vouchers or how a person was being given them. Oh well, no biggie. All in all, an OK stay for our 1st stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Absoluety bad !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not a good place to stay Bad Neighbor hood No parking space. Unsafe neighborhood to park They do not give good directions if you ask the front desk They charged my credit card twice and I had to call them several times after coming back to get a refund. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel on Sept. 17, 2004 and it was the worst hotel we have ever stayed in!!!! We got back to the hotel at 2am and all we wanted to do was sleep. Well, we pulled down the covers and realized there was a HUGE stain on the sheets so we called the front desk. The front desk sent up security to bring us new sheets. When the security guard pulled down the sheets to put the new sheets on we noticed there was a HUGE stain on the mattess too!! It was so disgusting!!! Even the security guard said it was digusting! He called the front desk and told them they needed to change the mattress! We did not want to stay in that room at all so they gave us another room. We checked out the next day and we wanted to show the guy at the front desk the stains in that room, but unfortunately they already checked some innocent customer in that disgusting room without changing the mattress!! Can you believe it????

Reviews.Title: “Good if you want Cheap!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Biltmore in December 2003. I have to say we were looking for a cheap place to sleep and shower, not luxury and amenities, so it fit the bill. The room was average and clean and very cheap. The hotel is older and a little run-down. The only really bad thing about the Biltmore is it has a funky smell (maybe disinfectant or air-freshener that wasn't fresh?). There was also some noise from the room next door, but not enough to complain, and I'm assuming it's safe since my brand new car wasn't broken into or vandalized. You can get a really good deal by going to their website and finding specials. If you're looking for cheap and basic, this might be a good option.

HotelInfo.Name: Howard Johnson Plaza Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 395 Kingsway, Vancouver, British Columbia V5T 3J7, Canada
